table.style: border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid;

para.text: This rotary switch is used to specify the feed per pulse in Handle mode. (Refer to

table.style: border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid;

td.style: vertical-align:top; width:2%; height:30px; border-top:none; border-right:none; border-bottom:none;

para.text: Reference position return is performed at the rapid feed override (0 - 100%) rate specified by NC parameter No. 01428 (Reference Position Speed Setting function) when the reference position has yet to be established after motor replacement or another such repair. When the feed rate has not been set by the NC parameter, it is fixed at approximately 4 m/min.

The Rapid Traverse Limit function can be used to limit the Rapid feed rate to 25 % (standard) during automatic and manual operation. This function can be enabled / disabled with M172 and on the Function screen. When this function is enabled, the background color of the
Machine Condition lamp on the screen is displayed in yellow.
Jog Feed and Cutting Feed Rate Override Switch

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:3px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:3px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: This rotary switch is used to specify the Jog feed rate. It is valid in the following cases:

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:3px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:3px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: When the Jog mode is selected.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:3px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:10px; margin-left:3px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: When the Dry Run mode is ON during automatic operation.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:3px; margin-right:3px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:3px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

para.text: This rotary switch applies an override to the specified cutting feed rate during automatic operation. This switch, however, is invalid when the Dry Run mode is selected. At this time, the Jog feed rate switch is valid instead. During a G84 Tapping Cycle and M49 Override Cancel, the feed rate is fixed at 100 %. When M132 is specified, the override rate is limited to 100 % or less. Any override value exceeding 100 % is invalid.
